title:
15k05 - Computation of OT under
CWHSSA when wage rate is higher than that required under DBRA or SCA.
text:
The wage rate actually paid
an employee for non-OT work, when it exceeds the applicable DBRA or SCA MW
rate, is the “basic rate” of pay on which not less than time and one-half for
OT must be computed under CWHSSA (See 29 CFR §§ 5.32(c)(l) and (2)). The “basic
rate” under CWHSSA is the rate on which time and one-half overtime compensation
is computed and paid under Section 7 of the FLSA.
html: The wage rate actually paid an employee for non-OT work, when it exceeds the applicable DBRA or SCA MW rate, is the “basic rate” of pay on which not less than time and one-half for OT must be computed under CWHSSA (See 29 CFR §§ 5.32(c)(l) and (2)). The “basic rate” under CWHSSA is the rate on which time and one-half overtime compensation is computed and paid under Section 7 of the FLSA.
